intro: Cleyera bokorensis, commonly known as the Bokorensis inkberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Actinidiaceae. It is native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia, specifically Cambodia and Vietnam. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, fleshy berries that are typically green when mature. Cleyera bokorensis is often found growing in shaded, moist environments within dense forest canopies.
